page.title: 05Local Agriculture + Goats!
page.content: The locality does not contain 1st rate argicultural land and is mostly used for{dairy farming.} {Godwins Farm}at{Lydiard Green}is a typical small local farm of some 75 acres of cultivated grass land on which a herd of{66 Friesians}graze. They produce 278,000 litres per year, this is stored in a cooling tank each day before it is taken to the{Unigate {Dairies}at Wootton Bassett. Many people keep{goats,}there being about 30 goats in the area, a mixture of{saanen, toggenburg}and{anglo {nubrians.}Most of the owners keep them for their milk, which they can drink or make into butter and cheese or sell. The male{"goatlings"}are slaughtered for meat. For most people the initial attraction of self_ sufficiency soon wears off due to the labour intensive nature of this hobby.
